_comment: 36 characters on line 1 before it clips into the drop stats
48 characters on other lines before it spills out of the UI
4 lines before it leaves the UI
custom.trivia.bee:
Floating about the forest,
Bees work tirelessly to produce Honeycombs
you can centrifuge into a variety of items.
Wait a minute, that's not quite right...
custom.trivia.salmon: Regularly migrates upstream to lay its eggs.
custom.trivia.llama:
Often found in Savannaâ€Œs,
Llamas are known for their hostility to all who dare touch them.
custom.trivia.pufferfish:
An annoying inhabitant of the Ocean.
Dispatch before it becomes bothersome.
custom.trivia.sniffer:
Meanders around, searching for food
- or maybe something else entirely?
custom.trivia.tropical_fish: Like a fish, but more tropical-y.
custom.trivia.turtle:
Wearing this may make you turtly enough for the turtle club.
(or make you some kind of ninja, perchance?)
custom.trivia.pillager:
The archers of the raider tribes
that wanders the Overworld,
searching for their next target.
custom.trivia.ravager:
An incredibly strong battle beast,
deployed only during the raids on villages
cursed by calloused adventurers.
custom.trivia.vindicator:
The front-line fighter of the
raider tribes that wanders the Overworld,
searching for their next target.

Be wary of their powerful swings.
_comment: Only used in Capitalia: Inward Expansion [1.19]
custom.trivia.martian_raptor:
Native to the martian wasteland,
little is known about these strange raptors.
custom.trivia.star_crawler:
The moon was thought to house nothing
but dust and rocks (and cheese, Gromit!).
These strange starfish have proven us wrong.
custom.trivia.frosted_skeleton:
When Skeletons are transported to the
Proxima System, they become imbued with frost.
custom.trivia.kent_fish:
A strange fish,
only encountered in the Proxima System.
custom.trivia.deep_one:
A mysterious race of fish-men, found
only within the depths of the Abyssal Chasm.
They enjoy bartering, but little else
is known about them.
custom.trivia.gossamer_worm:
Oh... it's so pretty!
Unless it's bait for a trap...?
But surely, that cannot be so!
custom.trivia.hullbreaker:
This massive monstrosity meticulously
maneuvers through the Abyssal Chasm,
feasting on all who trespass.

I guess that shiny worm was bait after all...
custom.trivia.lanternfish:
Lights its way through the Abyssal Chasm.
Perhaps you could take advantage of that?
Makes for a good snack.
custom.trivia.mine_guardian:
A specialized cousin of the Guardian
that protects the Abyssal Chasm from raiders.

Be sure to keep your distance around it.
custom.trivia.sea_pig:
The "pig of the sea" will eat
Clay, Mud, and Muck.

On occasion, it will excrete something useful.
custom.trivia.tripodfish:
A very curious type of fish
that walks along the abyssal floor.
Also makes for a good snack.
custom.trivia.caniac:
Maniacs who gorge themselves on
far too many Candy Canes are converted by the sugar,
becoming mere husks driven only
by the desire to feed their sweet addiction.
custom.trivia.caramel_cube:
When Caramel coalesces into life,
the humble Caramel Cube is born.
They resemble Slimes from the surface,
but will slow you down with their post-hop puddles.
custom.trivia.gingerbread_man:
"Run run, as fast as you can!
You can't catch me,
I'm the Gingerbread Man!"
- Gingerbread Man seconds before being killed.
custom.trivia.gum_worm:
Not to be confused with Gummy Worms.
Gum Worms burrow through the sugary rock,
eating it along the way.
Their sweet tooths are never sated.
custom.trivia.gumbeeper:
Unlike some gumball machines,
these ones don't manage a park
or defend the land from invaders.
custom.trivia.gummy_bear: I simply refuse to make the obvious reference.
custom.trivia.licowitch:
Masters of licorice and witchcraft,
a handful of these practitioners of magic learned
to combine both interests into one.
custom.trivia.sweetish_fish:
Not to be confused with Swedish Fish.
These ones are only partially sweet.

Sweet-ish, if you will.
custom.trivia.corrodent:
The oppressive darkness of the Hollow
must have mutated the rats within
to an extreme degree.
custom.trivia.forsaken:
When Vespers are infused
with Pure Darkness, their bodies warp into
this twisted aberration.
custom.trivia.gloomoth:
A peacful (yet annoying)
resident of the Hollow.
It seeks out light emanating from within its domain.
Zealots sacrifice them when possible.
custom.trivia.underzealot:
A devout worshipper of the Darkness,
compelled to destroy any lights
its strength permits it to.
custom.trivia.vesper:
Bats that meandered into the Hollow
and were twisted by its Darkness.

Zealots will sacrifice them when possible.
custom.trivia.watcher:
Born from a Ritual of Darkness,
the Watcher will stalk its prey -
waiting for the right moment to puppeteer them.
...but who watches the watcher?
custom.trivia.boundroid:
A strange automaton connected with a chain.
Its body roams the cavern's roof,
whilst its head attacks its foes below.
custom.trivia.ferrouslime:
A cousin of the standard Slime,
this one has a magnetic personality.
It can merge with its kin,
becoming stronger with every bond it forges.
custom.trivia.magnetron:
A most unusual creature,
composed entirely of iron and magnets.
When provoked, it will construct a body of
ferromagnetic blocks it detects nearby.
During this process, it is at its weakest.
custom.trivia.notor:
A most curious gizmo
that peruses Magnetic Caverns
in search of all manner of curiosities.
custom.trivia.teletor:
Golems like these have long roamed
Magnetic Caverns, searching for weaponry
they can repurpose as their own.
custom.trivia.atlatitan:
Once a Luxtructosaurus
is freed from its curse,
it will wander through the Primordial Grotto.
Loves to eat salads.
custom.trivia.grottoceratops:
Despite its outward appearance,
this saurian is rather peaceful.
custom.trivia.luxtructosaurus:
The luxuriously lethal Luxtructosaurus
is not a foe to be trifled with.
Doomed to bond with a Volcanic Core,
it now lies in wait for a worthy challenger.
custom.trivia.relicheirus:
This overgrown primordial chicken
can prove useful if tempted with primal soup.

Also makes for an excellent food source.
custom.trivia.subterranodon:
This flying reptile can be tamed & ridden.

Their favorite food is Trilocaris Tails.
custom.trivia.tremorsaurus:
Causes all to tremble when it roars.

Exercise caution when spelunking near them.
custom.trivia.trilocaris:
These rather sizeable arthropods
can be found all over the Primordial Grotto.
One of the few prey animals in the area.
custom.trivia.vallumraptor:
These raptors will loot
nearby Chests in search of food.

Clever girl...
custom.trivia.brainiac:
Feeding off of the toxic waste,
a pack of zombies fused with unknown creatures
to form this monstrosity.
Unlike others bearing its name, this has no interest in galactic archival.
custom.trivia.nucleeper:
Augmented with nuclear power,
this Creeper is an unquantifiable threat.
Its high fuse time is your only saving grace.
Run.
custom.trivia.radgill:
The Radgill (aka "Blinky")
is the product of fish that have fallen
into the Toxic Waste within the Dump.
It can be eaten, but I advise against it
custom.trivia.raycat:
One of few defenses from Nucleepers.

Tame it with Radgills if you want assistance.
custom.trivia.tremorzilla:
The product of your own hubris.
I wish you the best when trying to slay it.
PS: Try to have its beam kill a Nucleeper.
custom.trivia.bald_eagle:
An eagle that's lost its plumage (but not really).

Sadly not blue (nor is it accompanied by a fun tree).
custom.trivia.banana_slug:
Despite its namesake and appearance,
it is quite poisonous and unfit for consumption.
custom.trivia.bison:
Bison Leather makes for an excellent insulator,
and their large quantity of meat makes them a decent food source.
Just don't get too close...
custom.trivia.blobfish:
Squished into a mere blob upon surfacing,
its true appearance isn't too far off.
custom.trivia.blue_jay:
A simple bird that can be found all over.
You should name one Mordecai.
custom.trivia.bone_serpent:
Seems like it's from an
alternate dimension... but even if it's not,
ensure you exercise great caution around it.
custom.trivia.bunfungus:
This strange rabbit has been mutated
by some kind of spore or mold.

You could gather some ingredients for stew...
custom.trivia.cachalot_whale:
These large mammals reside in warm oceans.
You'll have a whale of a tale if you ever meet one.
custom.trivia.catfish:
Despite its name, it's not actually part cat.
Neither is the Dogfish, but they're not found here.
custom.trivia.cave_centipede:
A rare variant of a Giant Centipede,
this specimen didn't travel through a time portal.
custom.trivia.cosmic_cod: Not to be confused with the Flying Fish.
custom.trivia.crimson_mosquito:
A slightly larger variant of regular mosquitos,
this speciment is able to quickly drain the blood of its victims.
custom.trivia.crow:
Quoth the raven, "nevermore".

Wait, that's not quite right...
custom.trivia.endergrade:
An impossibly large Tardigrade,
the Endergrade's home is a strange dimension.
custom.trivia.farseer:
Guardians of the oft-forgotten "Farlands",
these automatons are designed to repel
all interlopers they encounter.
custom.trivia.fly:
An annoying insect,
flies can be found in every radii of the globe.
custom.trivia.flying_fish:
Not to be confused with the Cosmic Cod.
Oddly, these ones do not appear during rainstorms.
custom.trivia.froststalker:
These strange creatures resemble deer,
but act the opposite of them.
Exercise caution when near one.
custom.trivia.gazelle:
Incredibly agile, Gazelles can outpace almost everything.
Ensure you have great speed when dealing with them.
custom.trivia.giant_squid:
Mistaken for the Kraken in times long gone,
Giant Squids are a tricky beast to fight.
Make sure you can breath underwater before provoking it.
custom.trivia.grizzly_bear:
When fighting a Grizzly Bear,
do not do so.
custom.trivia.guster:
A strange, sentient tornado.

Don't let it throw you across the desert!
custom.trivia.laviathan:
These large lizards reside in the
lava pools of the Nether.
Composed of Basalt, Magma, and Obsidian,
they are one of the great mysteries of the realm.
custom.trivia.lobster:
Lobsters are immortal,
and only die due to growing so large they can no longer feed themselves.
(or they get eaten by something)
custom.trivia.mimic_octopus: These tiny octopodes will copy any nearby materials in an attempt to blend in with their environment.
custom.trivia.mimicube:
Corrupted by the End's magic,
these former slimes will copy their attacker.
Exercise caution when engaging one.
custom.trivia.moose: Do not attempt to fight a Moose.
custom.trivia.mudskipper: Does not actually skip across mud pools.
custom.trivia.murmur: "You are man.... he is not man."
custom.trivia.raccoon: You should name this one Cooper, for racoons are quite Sly.
custom.trivia.rattlesnake: If you hear rattling, leave the area.
custom.trivia.rocky_roller: A strange creature, almost like an Armadillo.
custom.trivia.shoebill:
A type of sea bird.
You could extract some feathers from its simulations.
custom.trivia.skelewag:
The remains of a Swordfish,
which feels compelled to guard the area it died in.
custom.trivia.skreecher:
Skreechers are a great danger to all caving expeditions.
Dispatch it or retreat before it has a chance to shriek.
custom.trivia.soul_vulture:
Kind of like a Vulture,
but it wants your soul instead of your corpse.
custom.trivia.straddler:
The Strider's larger cousin,
Straddlers will catapult their young when alarmed.
Doesn't have a warp cannon, either...
custom.trivia.tarantula_hawk:
It's a Tarantula -
and a Hawk, too!
custom.trivia.toucan:
Appears to be lacking loop-shaped fruits...
but you can still check, just in case.
custom.trivia.tusklin:
An Overworldian cousin to the Hoglin,
Tusklins are even worse to fight due to your lack of equipment.
custom.trivia.void_worm:
The ancient protector of the End,
usurped by the Ender Dragon millennia ago.
custom.trivia.warped_mosco:
An extremely mutated mosquito warrior.

Good luck.
custom.trivia.angler_fish: "Yeah, I see a light. Am I dead?"
custom.trivia.captain_cornelia:
Lost at sea long ago,
the Captain's spirit still lingers in her ship -
waiting to be freed from this plane of purgatory.
custom.trivia.eel:
This specimen has been mutated
by the Ice Maze's curse,
and is hyper-aggressive because of it.
custom.trivia.golden_moth:
A gold-encrusted Moth,
found only within the confines of the Ice Maze.
custom.trivia.maw:
Comparison cannot convey
the true nature of this creature.
custom.trivia.maze_mother:
The guardian of the Ice Maze,
who protects it no matter what.

No cost too great.
custom.trivia.spinefish:
Commonly spotted within the Ice Maze,
this fish swims aimlessly in search of its next meal.

Also found within the Lost River and Blood Kelp Zone.
custom.trivia.tortured_soul:
One of the innumerable sailor spirits
that can be found within the Ice Maze,
doomed to wander for eternity.
custom.trivia.coral_crab:
A strange variation of the humble crab
that sports a small coral reef on its back.
custom.trivia.coral_golem:
Guards its home with vigor.
Seems to ignore you, though...
custom.trivia.giant_squid_aquatic:
This large variant of a Squid is passive,
but would be a great source of ink if simulated...
custom.trivia.sponge_squid:
A squid that's bonded with a Sponge.

You could give it some square-shaped pants, if you'd like.
custom.trivia.sandy:
This thicker version of a Sand Dollar
can sport a variety of adornments on its... sandy covering?
Is it a carapace, a back, or something else?
custom.trivia.starbuncle:
Squirrels infused with Star Magic
sometimes transform into Starbuncles.
custom.trivia.whirlisprig:
A friendly forest spirit
that loves to hover around the place.
custom.trivia.wilden_chimera:
A pack of Wildens that have combined into one.

Doesn't seem to be made with alchemy,
but you never know...
custom.trivia.wilden_guardian:
A strong forest beast,
infused with magic through unknown means.

This variant has tough shell, lined with spikes.
custom.trivia.wilden_hunter:
A strong forest beast,
infused with magic through unknown means.

This variant tends to prefer close combat.
custom.trivia.wilden_stalker:
A strong forest beast,
infused with magic through unknown means.

This variant has wings, which makes attacks more agile.
custom.trivia.cochineal:
Its shell can be crushed into Red Dye.

No vat required!
custom.trivia.snail:
Is this just a slug with an identity crises?

It doesn't have a treehouse for a shell though,
so it's probably a snail.
custom.trivia.turkey:
Quite dry.

Not a very good food source due to that,
but if you're desperate enough...
custom.trivia.decayed:
Zombies remaining undead for too long
begin falling apart, rotting into Decayed
after the process is complete.
custom.trivia.ghost_makeover:
Villagers left to die (or slain in raids)
will become wandering spirits,
doomed to purgatory until freed from it.
custom.trivia.glowfish:
A bioluminescent variant of Fish.

What do you mean it's not called "Fish" anymore?
custom.trivia.helmit_crab: Not to be confused with a Hermit Crab.
custom.trivia.marauder_pillager:
A variant of the Pillager that has
learned of basic armor,
but still doesn't have enough to save himself
from your wrath.
custom.trivia.moth:
Floats around aimlessly at night.

Still best to keep it away from leather items...
custom.trivia.owl_makeover: Are Owls still a hoot at night?
custom.trivia.rootling:
A strange plant, akin to a Mandrake -
it will run around until escaping (or killed).

Although it doesn't curse you when harvested.
custom.trivia.scuttler:
Scuttles around the Badlands,
looking for its next meal.
custom.trivia.stone_golem:
Golems can be made out of
a variety of materials,
taking on varying traits based on their composition.
This one is strong, but static.
custom.trivia.toad:
Not to be confused with a Frog.

Although it is kind of like a land frog...
custom.trivia.nether_gauntlet:
A hand with an eye on it,
hell-bent on slaying you.

Seems oddly familiar, somehow...
custom.trivia.night_lich:
Doesn't guard a twilight tower,
but still wants you dead.
custom.trivia.obsidilith:
A tall obsidian tower,
emanating a menacing aura...
custom.trivia.void_blossom:
A flower of power,
determined to kill you where you stand.

No bulbs need to be broken to summon it.
custom.trivia.corpor:
An offshoot of Wither Skeletons.
Corpors are weaker, but more durable.

Still good to keep your guard up around them.
custom.trivia.warped_enderman:
Endermen who get trapped in a
Warped Forest may undergo severe mutation
due the magic within the area.
custom.trivia.wither_skeleton_knight:
Elite Wither Skeletons recognized
for their great strength and skill
are promoted to the rank of Knight.
custom.trivia.wraither:
Wither Skeletons who wander into
Soul Sand Valleys may become corrupted by it,
and the survivors transform into Wraithers.
_comment: Only used in Capitalia: Inward Expansion [1.19]
capitalia.trivia.dripstone_tortoise:
A Tortoise whose shell is
partially composed of Dripstone.
How did a Tortoise get into a cave?
I have no idea.
capitalia.trivia.goop:
A strange, living verison of the
random "goop" puddles scattered across various caves.
custom.trivia.mime:
A mysterious amalgamation of
Gemstones and Rocks.
custom.trivia.badloon:
The natural prey of monkeys, balloons
sometimes fall into the Ender Dragon's thrall
and begin to hunt down her enemies.
custom.trivia.bloviator:
Clouds infused with evil spirits.
Attempts to blow you off the floating islands
found around the area.
What do you mean "those don't exist?" They do!
custom.trivia.conjurer:
A magical fellow who loves to impress -
even building his own theatre!
But eventually, everyone grew weary of his same tired tricks.
This drove him mad with grief, rendering him an Illager.
custom.trivia.abomination:
An unholy amalgamation of
Sculk and Galm,
this aberration should be purged forthwith.
W3 423 n07 unh01y.
custom.trivia.corrupted_skeleton:
Skeletons wandering into the Deep Dark
are corrupted by the mysterious "Sculk" within,
as their bones make for an excellent habitat.
7h47 15 n07 72u3.
custom.trivia.ghost_jellyfish:
Flutters about the Deep Dark,
unaware of the corruption surrounding it.

W3 423 n07 7h3 c022up710n.
custom.trivia.sculk_parasite:
Disguises itself as a Sculk Sensor
to lure stray adventurers into the Sculk's fold.

W3 w0u1d d0 n0 5uch 7h1n9.
custom.trivia.spreader:
Wanders aimlessly through the world,
ignorant of the parasite it carries.

P4245173...? Wh47 p4245173?
custom.trivia.stalker_regrowth:
W3 423 w47ch1n9 y0u
_|(_)57 7(_)2|V 420(_)|V[).
(4|V 70(_) 533 (_)5?
[ERROR: Data encoding interrupted!]
custom.trivia.tentacle_lamp:
Provides light and basic defense for the Sculk,
allowing its parasites to feast and lure in
more prey at the same time.
W3 423 v32y 3ff1c13n7.
_comment: Only used in Capitalia: Inward Expansion (and it's from Sculky Bits) [1.19]
custom.trivia.sculk_saprophyte:
Serving as scouts for the Sculk,
these small nodules are best dispatched as quickly as possible.
5c0u75? wh47 f02?
custom.trivia.chaos_guardian:
Pure chaos overwhelming order
lovely visage guardian neutral healing wither
dragonhearted foolhardy secrets
inexperienced whelp total destruction chaotic order good evil neutral
custom.trivia.camel:
Seems oddly familiar....
but this one came first, right?
Regardless, make sure to keep it away rom identical rocks in the desert.
custom.trivia.coconut_crab:
Tough as a rock.
Probably doesn't eat people.
custom.trivia.penguin:
Passive birds found in the Arctic.

I propose you dub this one "Gunther."
Just be careful - it is one of the most evil creatures around, after all.
custom.trivia.squirrel:
Why would you want to
run VR simulations on a squirrel?
Did it throw you into an incinerator as a child?
Or do you want to staple it to a tree risk-free?
custom.trivia.concussion_creeper:
This variant of the Creeper
is not an inverse architect,
but rather a concussive blow to the head.
custom.trivia.enderminy:
Technology has sadly regressed,
and now prevents you from
transforming into one of these.
custom.trivia.fallen_knight:
Zombies in advanced stages of decay
become Fallen, and those skilled in combat
become Fallen Knights.
custom.trivia.infested_zombie:
Infested by enderic forces,
this Zombie now bears Books and Ender Shards,
attempting to remedy its mutation by any means.
custom.trivia.owl: I heard that Owls are a hoot at night.
custom.trivia.wither_cat:
When Wither Witches take a liking to a Cat,
they will convert it with their dark magic.
*Evil loaf!*
custom.trivia.wither_witch:
Like the regular Witch,
Wither Witches employ a variety of spells
to hinder your progress.
Often enters battle with their feline friends.
custom.trivia.booflo:
A strange flying frog, native to the End.
Its hides have limited uses, but are still exploitable.
custom.trivia.purpoid:
A curious floating jellyfish,
corrupted by the Ender Dragon's influence.
custom.trivia.ringling:
A strange variant of Mandrake Roots,
corrupted by the End's magic.
custom.trivia.stalker_enlightend:
Despite their name,
these enderic angler fish will attack on sight.
custom.trivia.deer:
Oh deer.

Make sure her child isn't nearby when you shoot.
custom.trivia.duck:
You're in for a ducking good time!
Might decide to seek out a nearby lemonade stands.
Perhaps you could rob it & invent combustible lemons?
custom.trivia.koi:
A certain old man may seek retribution
for anything you do to this fish.
Oh, it's not that type of koi?
Then start eating!
custom.trivia.pinecone_golem:
A rare specimen,
as Golems don't occur naturally very often.
custom.trivia.yak:
Does anyone read all
the yakking in these entries?
custom.trivia.aurora_deer:
Native to Permafrost Starlight Forests,
these Deer don't taste quite like you'd expect.
custom.trivia.crystallized_moth:
A multi-colored moth,
partially composed of magical crystals.
custom.trivia.ent:
A diminutive forest dweller,
unique to the Starlight Realm.
Smaller than its Overworldian counterparts
due to the lack of sunlight.
custom.trivia.freeze:
A distant relative of the Breeze, this
floating construct employs ice to slay its foes.
custom.trivia.gatekeeper:
Sworn to guard the Starlight Gateway,
this Gatekeeper only lets victorious challengers pass.

...and it seems like you've come out on top.
custom.trivia.grimstone_golem:
Golems constructed out of Grimstone
are protective, yet diminutive.
custom.trivia.lonestar_skeleton:
Wandering through the twisting caves
of the Starlight Realm takes a toll on all,
and a few unlucky souls
get converted into this shell.
custom.trivia.luminaris:
These lunar fish mainly inhabit the Abyss,
but may occasional swim to a nearby Starlight Sea.

They use their horns during mating rituals.
custom.trivia.luminofish:
These lunar fish mainly inhabit the Abyss,
but may occasional swim to a nearby Starlight Sea.
Their sensory organs are positioned
above their head to keep a look out for predators.
custom.trivia.lunar_monstrosity:
Twisted by the fallout of the Great Starlight War,
this floral aberration has taken up residence
in the Cursed Garden, consuming the souls of all
unfortunate enough to cross its roots.
custom.trivia.nightfall_spider:
These Spiders share their omnipresent
inhabitation with the regular variety -
but they're more aggressive than you'd think.
custom.trivia.ratlin:
A giant rodent,
native to the Starlight Realm.
It looks so soft...
custom.trivia.rookfish:
A strange sub-species of the Squid,
which seems to be shaped like a tower.
As for why, it is unknown.
custom.trivia.tower_squid:
A strange sub-species of the Squid,
which seems to be shaped like a tower.
As for why, it is unknown.
custom.trivia.starfire_bird:
A crimson red flying fowl.
Not the most useful of species...
custom.trivia.starlight_golem:
One of the last remnants of
the Great Starlight War, these Golems
spring to life when detecting an intruder.
custom.trivia.tangled:
When a Lunar Monstrosity consumes one's soul,
it begins converting it into a Tangled.
Part man and part plant, it is
forced to protect the Garden by its floristic master.
custom.trivia.tangled_hatred:
Extensions of a Lunar Monstrosity's will,
these vines will flail about the place
in an attempt to stop trespassers.
Attack their roots to dispatch them.
custom.trivia.thirst_walker:
Eternally damned
to wander the Crystallized Desert,
these mere husks of men
can never sate their dehydration.
custom.trivia.yeti:
Rolling around Permafrost Starlight Forests,
these small Yetis are quite playful.
Do they guard a Snowy Hill, a Mansion, or a Needle?
If it's the latter, do they snowboard at all?
_comment: The Copper Golem's entry covers a few mods cuz i'm lazy lol.
custom.trivia.copper_golem:
This diminutive cousin of the Iron Golem
will accomplish whatever menial task you assign to it.
custom.trivia.crab_friend:
Found on Beaches, the humble Crab
yields claws with reach-altering properties when slain.
custom.trivia.glare:
These floating clumps of moss and leaves seek out well-lit areas.
Glow Berries are their favorite foods.
custom.trivia.iceologer:
A distant relative of the Evoker,
the Iceologer deploys its frosty force
against all who encroach upon its domain.
custom.trivia.illusioner:
A relative of the Evoker,
this master of illusionary magic
is sure to confused and befuddle everyone.
custom.trivia.tuff_golem:
This diminutive cousin of the Iron Golem
displays anything you give it - just ensure it doesn't wander away from its post.
custom.trivia.wildfire:
Master of all Blazes, the Wildfire
is incredibly tough for unprepared adventurers.

Ensure you can resist its firey wrath.
custom.trivia.berserker:
Berserkers protect their
crystalline companions with all of their might.
Exercise great caution when engaging them.
custom.trivia.preserved:
This salt-laden remnant of a Zombie is
controlled by Berserkers.
Both protect their domain with great will.
custom.trivia.amphithere:
A neutral flying lizard.
As far as we know, it guards no temples.
custom.trivia.cockatrice:
A nightmarish chicken-like beast.
Has never been told that it's not nice to stare.
custom.trivia.cyclops:
A one-eyed monstrosity
that claims to have been blinded by "nobody."
Do you really believe it, though?
custom.trivia.death_worm:
As the name implies, this worm craves death.
It will stop at nothing to slay (and/or eat) you.
custom.trivia.dread_beast:
Corrupted by the Dread Queen,
these beasts attack anyone who trespassess.
custom.trivia.dread_ghoul:
A mere corpse,
corrupted by the Dread Queen's power.
Follows its base instincts,
protecting whatever its master decrees worthy.
custom.trivia.dread_knight:
Even a disciplined knight
is not immune to the Dread Queen's serenade.
custom.trivia.dread_lich:
An ancient necromancer
who fell to the Dread Queen's power.
Not even powerful mages are immune to her song.
custom.trivia.dread_scuttler:
Mere insects have no hope of resisting
the enthralling melody of the Dread Queen.
custom.trivia.dread_thrall:
Enslaved by the Dread Queen,
Thralls protect what little treasure she still holds.
custom.trivia.fire_dragon:
A ruthless reptile,
Fire Dragons are vulnerable to ice attacks
and can be taken down with enough persistence.
custom.trivia.ice_dragon:
A wintry cousin to the Fire Dragon,
Ice Dragons can be melted with enough fire and grit.
custom.trivia.lightning_dragon:
Electrically charged by their
cloud-laden abodes,
Lightning Dragons can (and will) electrocute you.
custom.trivia.ghost:
Spectres of the night,
Ghosts will haunt you until exorcised.
custom.trivia.hippocampus:
These strange horse-fish hybrids
can be ridden underwater when tamed.
custom.trivia.hippogryph:
A most strange hybrid, unknown
to even the most seasoned of adventurers.
Old myths tell of how some members
prefer to live in the oceans.
custom.trivia.hydra:
Even Heracles required help with this nemesis.
Good luck.
custom.trivia.myrmex_queen:
Ruler of the Myrmex,
all of which will defend the nest and their Queen
at all costs - even if they die during a failed attempt.
custom.trivia.myrmex_royal:
A rank (or two) below the Queen,
Myrmex Royals are her personal guard
custom.trivia.myrmex_sentinel:
Guardians of the Hive, Myrmex Sentinels
will ferociously guard their Queen.
custom.trivia.myrmex_soldier:
Persistent defenders of the Hive,
Myrmex Soldiers will fight to the death
to protect their Queen.
custom.trivia.myrmex_worker:
The lowest rank in a Myrmex Hive,
workers will cautiously trade Resin with outsiders.
custom.trivia.pixie:
Mischievous faeries, Pixies will steal
whatever they can - quickly escaping afterwards.
Always remain vigilant in their presence.
custom.trivia.sea_serpent:
Thought to be the stuff of legend,
many a sailor will tell tall tales of Sea Serpent
tails terrorizing a trail of tricky tortuous tribulations.
custom.trivia.siren:
A mariner's true nightmare
is not the sea, but its occupents.
Sirens will employ every tactic to lure you to an
untimely death.
custom.trivia.stymphalian_bird:
A metallic terror,
Stymphalian Birds will launch their
feathers as if they were arrows at anyone
unfortunate enough to cross its path.
custom.trivia.troll:
A native denizen of the
fourth dimension's "internet",
Trolls will employ all sorts of
gravity-defying launches to slay their foes.
custom.trivia.ancient_knight:
Knights who fell in battle while defending the Nether
are often possessed by the latent magic in the air,
forcing them to resume their post.
custom.trivia.apothecarist:
A rare breed of passive Piglins,
these ones are more than willing to trade
various plants and herbs.
custom.trivia.archevoker:
Some Evokers train for decades to master their craft.
Often times, the magic will corrupt their minds -
rendering them even more hostile than before.
custom.trivia.cryomancer:
Some Villagers choose to master Ice Magic -
no crown required.
custom.trivia.dead_king:
The corpose of an unknown king,
cursed to defend its grave until the end of time.
custom.trivia.ice_spider:
An arachnid, coated in frosty magic.
May prove annoying to fight without any heat-based attacks.
custom.trivia.necromancer:
Necromancy is a tricky art -
and one that should not be taken lightly.
Those who master it wield great power - at the cost of their very soul.
custom.trivia.priest:
Sworn to purge all evil from this world,
priests are more than willing to offer their expertise
to all who can afford their wares.
custom.trivia.pyromancer:
Opposite yet equal to Cryomancy,
Pyromancy required much greater discipline due to the destructive force fire rends upon the unprepared..
custom.trivia.banshee:
Blazes possessed by Apparitions
are converted into Banshees,
screaming their final thoughts when attacking.
custom.trivia.ecto_slab:
Even Magma Cubes are not immune to possession.
If an Apparition overtakes one, it produces an Ecto Slab.
Be on-guard for their burrowing attack.
custom.trivia.stampede:
A tall variant of the Strider,
Stampedes sadly do not offer
a higher perspective of the world.
custom.trivia.vessel:
Apparitions seek out hosts,
and Skeletons make for an excellent home.
These Vessels are quite dangerous,
and you should not fight them unprepared.
custom.trivia.amethyst_crab:
When giant crabs encounter an
Amethyst Geode, a few of them get too curious
and transform into an ambulatory Geode.
custom.trivia.ancient_remnant:
Ancient remains of a long-dead dinosaur,
reanimated by unknown magic.
custom.trivia.aptrgangr:
The undead leader of the Draugrs,
Aptrgangr wields his oversized battleaxe with great dexterity.
custom.trivia.cindaria:
A strange fighter,
evokative of a Jelllyfish.
custom.trivia.clawdian:
Some crustaceans
evolve past the peak of crabhood,
forming their own warrior caste in the process.
custom.trivia.coral_golem_cataclysm:
Guardians of Coral Reefs,
these Golems are even deadlier than iron ones
due to their sharp coral protrusions.
custom.trivia.coralssus:
A veteran Coral Golem.
Not as sharp, but still deadlier.
custom.trivia.deepling:
Strange residents of aquatic dungeons.
Little is known about them.
custom.trivia.draugr:
Rarely, a Viking who perishes
does not go to Valhalla or Hel -
instead, they are doomed to wander the Earth
as an undead warrior.
Their search for peace in the afterlife is neverending.
custom.trivia.drowned_host:
The unwilling host of a Symbiocto.
It's best to put them out of their misery before
their anguished cries dominate your psyche.
custom.trivia.elite_draugr:
A veteran Viking spirit,
hardened by decades of battle.
custom.trivia.endermaptera:
These bothersome beetles
are native to the End.
As with all ankle-biters,
the only good bug is a dead bug.
custom.trivia.hippocamtus:
Guardians of a sunken treasure,
once thought to be lost forever.
custom.trivia.ignis:
Ruler of the fiery realm of the Nether,
Ignis is a challenging adversary.
Ensure you're as close to fireproof
as one can be before taking on his challenge.
custom.trivia.ignited_berserker:
Cousin to the Blaze,
this armored adversary will defend
its domain to the death.
custom.trivia.ignited_revenant:
Cousin to the Blaze,
this reinforced warrior will offer quite the fight
to defend its fortified abode.
It kind of reminds you of something...
custom.trivia.kobolediator:
A Kobold Gladiator's skeleton.
Watch out for its giant sword.
custom.trivia.koboleton:
A swift, skeletal Kobold.
Try to re-kill it before it stabs you to death.
custom.trivia.lionfish_cataclysm:
A deep sea hunter,
Lionfish will venomize their prey before eating it.
custom.trivia.maledictus:
A ghostly king who's sworn
to kill you where you stand -
but is his fury righteous, or vindictive?
custom.trivia.netherite_monstrosity:
Guardian of all that is hellish,
this amalgamation of Netherite and will
is bound to destroy all
who are foolish enough to challenge it.
custom.trivia.royal_draugr: A royal Viking spirit who possessed great wealth in life.
custom.trivia.scylla:
A monstrous warrior,
dead-set on eradicating you.
custom.trivia.symbiocto:
Some Octopodes desire control,
and will find a host to overtake.

Usually, it's crabs that do this...
custom.trivia.the_harbinger:
An advanced form of the Wither,
made far deadlier with several augmentations.
custom.trivia.the_prowler:
This mechanical monstrosity
is hellbent on hunting you down.

Hunt it before it hunts you.
custom.trivia.the_watcher:
An autonomous scanner,
dispatched to spy on you.

Will defend itself if needed.
custom.trivia.urchinkin: Evil urchins that seek to destroy you.
custom.trivia.wadjet:
The remains of
an ancient serpentine warrior,
sworn to defend its master.
custom.trivia.crystalline_slime:
Sometimes, Slimes will absorb Crystals
and be converted into these.
They tend to be more hostile as a result.
custom.trivia.jawbreaker:
Unlike its name implies,
this is alive and wants to break your jaw.
I suppose that's still mostly accurate, though...
custom.trivia.alf_pixie:
Alfheim is known
to house many magical creatures,
but most never venture outside of their realm.
custom.trivia.afrit:
A wandering spirit,
ripe for exploitation.
custom.trivia.possessed_endermite:
Even enderic creatures aren't immune
to the influence of the occult.
custom.trivia.man_o_war:
A rare siphonophore
whose venom can take down
even the hardiest of men.
custom.trivia.oddion:
An odd onion
that seems to exhibit sentience.
Still edible, though.
custom.trivia.chorus_squid:
This strange offshoot of standard squids
somehow made its way to the End, and was corrupted by it.
custom.trivia.entombed:
Doomed to a purgatory of wandering,
these bulwarks of Purpur attack all who disturb their stupor.
custom.trivia.himmelite:
A strange mass of crystals and flora,
bonded together by enderic forces.
custom.trivia.purpur_golem:
Constructed from
Chorus Fruit and Ender Eyes,
these Golems are compelled to protect
the Tower that fabricated it.
custom.trivia.sinker:
These "Sinkers"
are far beyond most forms of understanding.
They inhabit the various Geysers found in the
enderic realm, and posses sharpened teeth.
custom.trivia.spectrafly:
A strange type of fly,
found only within the outer islands of the End.
custom.trivia.stalker:
Lurking in the shadows,
Stalkers will wait until their prey
is at its most vulnerable before striking.
custom.trivia.crab:
Rarely found on beaches.
Don't get too crabby when trying to find them!
custom.trivia.foxhound:
When Foxes or Wolves are trapped in
the Nether, the magic within bonds to them,
imbuing them with a fiery rage.
custom.trivia.stoneling:
This strange creature inhabits caves,
carrying a variety of items.
Unfortunately, they are quite skittish.
Further research is pending due to this.
custom.trivia.toretoise:
As the name implies, Toretoises
are tortoises with ores on their shells.
Their ores can be harvest with a pickaxe.
custom.trivia.wraith:
A haunting apparition, formed from the
lost souls trapped within the Soul Sand Valley.
Their remnants guide travellers towards the
Great Fortress.
custom.trivia.wrapped:
This Zombie seems to have gotten himself
stuck inside of a Cobweb.
custom.trivia.executioner:
These troops are dispatched
only when absolutely necessary,
with one simple command: To execute order 66.
custom.trivia.griefer:
Assigned to those
the Arch-Illager deems an extreme nusiance.

Sure to make you go "Griefer? Aww man!"
custom.trivia.trickster:
Some Evokers attempt a comedy career
when they're bored with mansion guarding duty.
I will leave the evaluation up to you.
custom.trivia.conjurling:
A magical pest,
hell-bent on hunting you down.
custom.trivia.dungeon_effigy:
A living statue,
whose purpose is to hunt you.
custom.trivia.dungeon_sentry:
Protects the dungeon
with Midas' blessing.
custom.trivia.duskrok:
An imposing warrior,
sworn to protect the dungeon with its life.
custom.trivia.echo_bug:
An insect who bugs you to death.
An insect who bugs you to death.
custom.trivia.elite_skeleton:
Some Skeletons forego bows
in favor of more deadly weaponry.

Unlike others, these won't relinquish their scopes.
custom.trivia.fairies:
"Hey, listen!"

Those are the words fairies tend to utter
before assisting in your quest.
custom.trivia.gatmancer:
A wizard, with a gun.

Not to be confused for Wizard with a Gun.
custom.trivia.gob:
The King of all Gnomes, who manages
his heliophobia far better than his subjects.
custom.trivia.shadow_wizards:
Gundalf the Gray is an Archmage
with extensive combat mastery.
Crossing him is sure to spell your doom.
His underlings won't go down without a fight, either.
custom.trivia.hellrok:
A fiery compliment to the Duskrok.

This variant is stronger and hits harder.
custom.trivia.simple_turret:
A simple automaton,
constructed to guard various dungeons.
custom.trivia.super_sniffer:
When chaotic emeralds
contact a Sniffer,
it gets infused with sayonic power.
custom.trivia.ultra_sniffer:
The Sniffer's final form,
Bearing a power level well over 9,000.
I don't think you'll be able to fight this.
custom.trivia.uvogre: It's like an Ogre, but different.
custom.trivia.virtue:
Patience is a virtue,
but reckless abandon is fairly close.
custom.trivia.ender_slime:
Found in the End,
this sub-species of the Slime can be used to
increase the range of one's tools.
You can even use it in place of Slimeballs!
custom.trivia.sky_slime:
Found high in the sky,
this sub-species of the Slime
jumps much higher than its land-bound cousins.
You can even use it in place of Slimeballs!
custom.trivia.terracube:
An offshoot of the standard Slime,
Terracubes are well-adapted
to their clay-filled habitats.

It can even be converted into Smeltery materials!
custom.trivia.goose:
Geese are some of the most hostile
and unpleasent members of the animal kingdom.

Trapping them in a simulation is about what they deserve.
custom.trivia.jellyfish:
Jellyfish are a curious species.
Composed of a multitude of smaller organisms,
they drift aimlessly without
so much as internal organs.
- yet they continue to persist, forever meandering through the ocean...
custom.trivia.lionfish:
Be careful near these venomous fish.
They look nice, but might not act so if provoked.
custom.trivia.nautilus:
Doomed to always swim backwards,
these strange creatures never leave their tough shell.
custom.trivia.pike:
Not to be confused with Pike (weapon)

The Pike is a carnivorous fish found in
both salt and fresh water.
custom.trivia.thrasher:
This specialized shark resides in trenches,
dragging prey to the sea floor before drowning it.

Exercise extreme caution around them.
custom.trivia.great_thrasher:
An elder Thrasher,
tougher than its kin due to years of experience.

Exercise extremer caution around them.
custom.trivia.glow_squid:
Seems oddly familiar...
but this one came first, right?
custom.trivia.wisp:
Lives to lure humans to an untimely demise.
Take caution when near one.
custom.trivia.sickened_animal:
Even innocent creatures aren't spared
from the Wither Storm's corruption.
custom.trivia.sickened_creeper:
Creepers corrupted by the Storm
have their explosive volatility amplified.
custom.trivia.sickened_iron_golem:
Iron Golems corrupted by the Storm
have their strength increased,
and become aggressive to all life forms.
custom.trivia.sickened_skeleton:
Skeletons corrupted by the Storm
gained increased accuracy - and newfound bloodlust.
custom.trivia.sickened_spider:
Spiders corrupted by the Storm
become hostile to everything nearby.
custom.trivia.sickened_zombie:
Zombies corrupted by the Storm
have their unnatural hunger increased tenfold.
custom.trivia.withered_symbiont:
An extension of the Storm's will,
this vassal will deliver you to it at all costs.
custom.trivia.ice_cube:
A strange block of sentient ice.
How peculiar...

...kind of cool, too.
custom.trivia.sand_snapper:
A most unique creature
that feeds on various types of sand
(or perhaps silica in general?)
